title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\SecurityPolicy
name: SecurityPolicy
description:
Represents a Google Cloud Armor security policy resource.

Only external backend services that use load balancers can reference a security policy. For more information, see Google Cloud Armor security policy overview. (== resource_for {$api_version}.securityPolicies ==)

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.SecurityPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.fingerprint
params.description: Specifies a fingerprint for this resource, which is essentially a hash of the metadata's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update metadata. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change metadata, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet. To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the security policy.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output only] Type of the resource. Always compute#securityPolicyfor security policies

params.name: data.name
params.description: Name of the resource. Provided by the client when the resource is created. The name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.rules
params.description: A list of rules that belong to this policy. There must always be a default rule (rule with priority 2147483647 and match "*"). If no rules are provided when creating a security policy, a default rule with action "allow" will be added.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined URL for the resource.

methods.description:
Specifies a fingerprint for this resource, which is essentially a hash of the metadata's contents and used for optimistic locking. The fingerprint is initially generated by Compute Engine and changes after every request to modify or update metadata. You must always provide an up-to-date fingerprint hash in order to update or change metadata, otherwise the request will fail with error 412 conditionNotMet.

To see the latest fingerprint, make get() request to the security policy.
